sentence: The tail end of the year is generally in high Holiday spirits and investors are hawk-eyed on the performance of every notable retailer.
We wonder if this over-enthusiasm was behind last week's retail sell-off that led to the bottoming of the major U.S. indices.

One perspective would show that the markets actually overreacted to the dismal sales performance by retail bellwethers Nordstrom JWN and Macy's M , as market sentiment seemingly perked up again this week, with the indices gaining momentum.

If we dig deeper, the Commerce Department's retail sales data that edged up only 0.1% for October and the fall in Consumer Confidence Index in the same month could well be nagging investors, especially those whole focus solely on the retail corner.
If reactions to individual company performances were to decide the fate of the stock market, then the Wall Street would not know where to go.

Since the markets have bounced back this week, we can safely conclude that last week's retail slump is not here to stay and that retailers are on their toes once again to indulge in this year's shopping extravaganza.
Amid all the pessimism that crept in with the sell-off, investors actually lost sight of the retail players that crushed earnings expectations in this season.
That said, we put the spotlight on 5 retail stocks with a favorable Zacks Rank that topped this quarter and have desirable prospects.
Amazon.com Inc.AMZN is the largest online retailer in the world.
This Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) stock delivered a positive earnings surprise of 270% in third-quarter 2015 and has soared 113.8% year to date.
The company has seen its earnings estimate for 2015 jump 17.5% to $1.81 per share over the last 30 days.
Based in Seattle, the company delivered an average positive earnings surprise of nearly 148% over the trailing four quarters and has a long-term earnings growth rate of 35.6%.
Home Depot Inc.HD , which carries a Zacks Rank #2, is the world's largest home improvement specialty retailer based on net sales.
The company posted third-quarter fiscal 2015 adjusted earnings of $1.36 per share, beating the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $1.32.
The Atlanta-based company delivered an average positive earnings surprise of 4.02% over the trailing four quarters, while the earnings estimate for fiscal 2015 moved up by 0.2% over the past 7 days.
Further, the company's stock is up 20.5% year to date and has a long-term earnings growth rate of 14.2%.
McDonald's Corp.MCD is a leading fast-food chain that currently operates over 36,000 restaurants in more than 100 countries.
The company posted earnings per share of $1.40 that beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $1.27 by 10.2%.
Holding a Zacks Rank #2, the company has seen its earnings estimate for 2015 rise 3.6% to $4.87 per share over the past 30 days.
Also, this Oak Brook, IL-based company registered an average positive earnings surprise of 4.78% over the trailing four quarters and has a long-term earnings growth rate of 8.4%.
Moreover, the company's shares have surged over 20% year to date.
BJ's Restaurants Inc.BJRI operates as a casual dining chain in the U.S.
This Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) company posted adjusted earnings of 39 cents per share, beating the Zacks Consensus Estimate by 25.8%.
The company also possesses a spectacular earnings history, having outperformed the Zacks Consensus Estimate by an average of 30.63% over the past four quarters.
Further, this Orange County, CA-based company has seen its earnings estimate for 2015 advance 7.4% to $2.38 per share over the past 30 days.
Moreover, the company has a long-term earnings growth rate of 20.1%.
Last but not least is eBay Inc.EBAY with a Zacks Rank #2.
The company, which is one of the largest online retailers in the world today, posted earnings of 35 cents per share, ahead of the Zacks Consensus Estimate by 6.06%.
The company's earnings estimates for 2015 have move upward by 4% to $1.56 per share, over the past 30 days.
Based in San Jose, CA, the company delivered an average beat of 8.85% over the trailing four quarters, with a positive surprise in each.
Also, its 7.1% long-term earnings growth rate and 21.7% year-to-date stock growth, underscore its potential.
These retail top performers of the season have time and again proved their mettle, clearly evident from their surprise history and the stock price movements.
Further, the upward estimate revisions based on their positive outlook reveal that these stocks are positioned to gain this year as the holiday season takes on.
